comments.body: Undead mobs should be immune because they are already cold and dead
Not the vex
I think this is what they intended
Wonderful idea. Perhaps you'll add to the idea that you can sell your findings to villagers
Warden can wear Axolotl as a hat
Currently, the warden just kills an axolotl if the warden notices the axolotl too much.
I like this idea. You could throw your items to the goat. Sort of like a mobile trash can lol.

Great idea but goats don’t actually eat everything. It’s a common myth. Goats stick to normal food such as leaves, grass, bush, clover and grain. To be honest they're even slightly picky eaters. This should be implemented into Minecraft as that would spread the myth. All those stories about goats eating pants and boots are fake. The closest I’ve seen a goat to eating a non edible thing is when they tried to suck on on of my jacket tags. So, good idea but this might not be the best thing to be added.

This is a great idea! My thought is that goats should eat the bottom leaves of trees like they do IRL. It would make them useful to keep around your house if it's in a forest. In comics, goats always eat cans from canned food, so I think they should eat leather and iron armor if you drop it.
I would love to see that!
I think that they should also add cow bells (No not that type of cowbell; same idea as the Goat Bell).
Bells could be added to all mobs. Also, animals like cats should also play with bells

This, in a similar way, has been proposed before already, see:

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360042520571-Animals-with-bells

But there should be a gamerule for people to turn that on and off (except for copper then). I can understand not everyone wants that to happen.

I do love this idea tho

Trees should generate with mossy logs since many do IRL in wetter environments. They're also adding Moss in the Lush Caves (maybe used to spread it) so it makes sense to put Age mechanics to that as well.

Iron should get rusted, near water, too. The iron ore looks rusted, yet there's no way to make iron blocks look the same way.

To make it less annoying it could have aging on builds/chunks the player doesn't visit as much so that they won't have to clean their base or house as much and so that it makes them visit their old places sometimes. There could also be a system where if villagers, pillagers, or piglins are in the chunk it won't age (so the player can prevent the build from falling apart and so that naturally generated structures won't fall apart if mobs live in it).
If this was added, it would happen super slowly so that it would only become apparent after the world was played for a long time. Also, many structures are already eroded.

It’s strange that copper would have stair and slab variants unlike any other ore in the game, one way to balance this would be to add a metalwork station or an ability to modify the stonecutter (diamond toothed stonecutter?).
Function is obvious, and would be best complimented by the addition of gold and iron stairs/slabs/cut blocks
Would be greatly appreciated!!
Yeah I’ve been trying to build a decent sized building for a few weeks now with a copper roof and it’s extremely hard to find enough copper to finish it
I have been trying to make a copper roof for days. I managed to mine like over 100 stacks of copper ore and it still wasn't enough. Like come on, that's just insanity. Somebody fix this pleasssssss.
We need this

Also, unless un-cut versions of the stairs and slabs are craftable, remove the word "cut" from the name of those items, because it's redundent.
Likewise, you can remove the word "pollished," from "pollished blackstone bricks," beacuse all blackstone bricks are pollished.
Yesss this needs to be added
Sound like a good idea to me!

Check out similar posts like Freezing Snowballs.

It'd be Super Immersive for Powdered Snowballs to Freeze any mob on impact, then Crouching to place & stack snowballs by left clicking or trigger & right click to take from the stack.
Thanks for the suggestions!
I for one like this idea but maybe we can use it to stun mobs instead just a suggestion?.
How do you know how common they are- they havent released the update yet-

So you obviously don't know this, which is okay, but they try to spawn new things in snapshots as much and everywhere they can without making it look too much, because the players should be able to find the new things very quickly in the nature without searching for hours.

And then Bedrock Edition will just take the code from the first snapshot available and end up implementing it no matter how many revisions Java gets before the update's full release. We've seen it with Trident drop rates for Drowneds, we've seen it with mob spawn rates in Soul Sand Valleys, and who is to say we won't see it with geodes?
Y same

I agree, I was just about to comment on this. I love the classic texture pack but it doesn't work well because for example netherack and nether gold ore have different textures and it makes exploring the nether so annoying with the classic texture pack.

When i activate the resource pack of classic texture pack, it doesnt work. I tried other texture packs and they worked perfectly fine. I tried deactivate and reactivate it but this pack still wont work. I am so disappointed to that..

Agree, they haven't updated anything yet, not even the Nether Update blocks, and now creepers have the charged creeper texture if I use the classic texture pack, a shame for Mojang. Meanwhile, 4J Studios still updates all their texture packs.
I like this idea, and to go with it, I think amethyst blocks should also have a brighter texture to show they are actually shiny. The texture right now seems a little too dull for being a crystal.
I think the sparkles should a white stationary particles that suddenly appear and disappear when they shrink.
Maybe there would be a sound effect that goes along with it. So it'd make an ambient idle sound in addition to the sound it makes when you walk on it.
This is exactly what we need. I think it would be perfect for a castle and could easily fit in with the Minecraft aesthetic.

a great idea when it comes to note blocks.

The note blocks quickly become quiet if you walk away a little. A gramaphone funnel (made from the horn and copper) increases the range.

I can also imagine sound tubes that pick up the sound and emit it via the funnel a little further away.
Maybe one can plant it in a low light area and it’ll grow some skulk vegetation

This is a fair trade to a problem I had with Farmable Skulks. Skulks shouldn't be able to be easily farmable. Wireless Redstone is already crazy enough, and it should be expensive. Having to go down to the depths to fight the deadly Warden should be enough of a sacrifice to boost the value exponentially. Killing the Warden, on the other hand, and having it drop a rare item is fair. A goal I have is to automate everything. While I don't think automation is bad, too much automation is. This is the issue I have: I feel there should be a reason to go down to the depths more. As implied earlier, Skulks should be hard to get. 
I will say one thing: I am not against farmable Wardens. I do have a solution to combat this though, and I believe this solution is mutual.

Possible solutions I came up with are:

1. The Seed from Warden should grow into limited Skulkers. What I mean is while you can get one-or a couple-of Skulker Sensors from one seed. The grown Skulkers will not produce seeds, and you have to go back to kill more Wardens for more seeds.

2. Skulkers should only be farmable on their native block, keeping you coming down to the mine, like the geodes already in the cave update. 

3. Skulker seeds shouldn't grow the block, but as you said, "something required to craft the skulk sensor". Once it grows, and you harvest it (whether it be automatic or manual),  the other resources should not be farmable, sort of like naturally generating ores like diamonds or lapis lazuli.
Maybe, it is cultivable in lower levels into the new deep-caves stone block (under 20 or 15 block level)

I feel like Sculk seeds are a good idea they can be like pumpkins or watermelons in minecraft but it being a rare drop does not seem like a good idea like it should be a normal plant in the deep dark and the sculk sensor could be common bc youtubers like MumboJumbo and regular people on hermitcraft could want the skulk sensor (if they reset the biomes) and it could be a good use
probably not a drop from warden (the devs do not want the warden to be killed a lot)

The axolotl is a predator and so I think it's normal for it to start eating tadpoles it sees. Also this makes people assume putting an axolotl and a bunch of tadpoles in the same aquarium thinking they'll be friends is a good idea which it DEFINITELY isn't unless you want the tadpoles to be eaten.

I agree. But i think the Deep dark biome should remain. You would find a deep dark biome, And then go to the Deep Dark (or maybe another name) Dimension. Then you would find much more content there. So the deep dark biome would be a mini version of the Actual dimension.

I made a post a while ago concerning gilding tools so here is what i have to offer on the matter:

First: It would make most sense for only netherite tools to have the ability to be gilded. This is because netherite is already made with gold and other stages of the game often pass too quickly for upgrading tools to be worthwhile.

Second: You said "combine a tool with gold in a smithing table to increase durability". This is illogical since gold tools have low durability.

Third: To make this make more sense, gilded tools should in my opinion have a durability somewhere between that of a netherite and gold tool. Because this is a drawback, gilded tools would also get better enchants since gold tools do that in game.

Conclusion: Using a gold ingot with a netherite tool in a smithing table should gild it, making the tool have a gold color name and a different texture.

A gilded tool would have lower durability BUT it would have increased mining speed and it would be easier to enchant. Gilding tools multiple times could make the tool more gilded and restore its durability. But... be carefull! gilding a tool too much will make it into a gold tool.

I like the Idea, but It would make sense if you could only obtain it by shearing it off the warden's head, which will regenerate after 15 seconds. all the while the warden starts freaking out and begins hitting everything around it. upon regeneration however, the warden will immediately take notice of the player (given they're still close enough) and will begin chasing them at full rage.
this is a bad idea ngl
